words.definition: An accountant is a person whose job is to keep financial accounts.
words.example: The accountant helped me keep track of my money.

words.definition: A capitalist is a business person who invests in trade and industry for profit.
words.example: The capitalist invested in a factory that made wheat into cereal.

words.definition: Contempt is the feeling of having no respect for something.
words.example: The judge had contempt for the wicked criminal.

words.definition: To dedicate oneself to something means to put a lot of time and effort into it.
words.example: The nun dedicated herself to helping people in need.

words.definition: A ditch is a narrow hole dug into the ground, usually at the side of a road or field.
words.example: The car slid off the road and into a ditch.

words.definition: An enterprise is a company or business.
words.example: The new enterprise was very successful in its first year.

words.definition: When something is exquisite, it is very beautiful and delicate.
words.example: The bride wore an exquisite dress made of silk.

words.definition: To finance something means to provide the money needed for it.
words.example: The bank agreed to finance the manâ€™s new business.

words.definition: When someone is indifferent, they have no interest in something.
words.example: He was indifferent to the news and didn't even look up from his book.

words.definition: To irrigate means to supply water to land or crops.
words.example: The farmer used a system of pipes to irrigate his fields.

words.definition: To maximize something means to make it as large as possible.
words.example: The company wants to maximize its profits this year.

words.definition: When something is monetary, it relates to money.
words.example: The house has a high monetary value.

words.definition: A precaution is an action that is meant to stop something bad from happening.
words.example: As a precaution, you should wear a helmet when you ride a bike.

words.definition: Preliminary describes something that happens before a main event.
words.example: The runners had a preliminary race to see who would be in the final.

words.definition: To saturate something means to soak it completely.
words.example: The rain saturated the ground after the heavy storm.

words.definition: Simplicity is the state or quality of being simple.
words.example: The simplicity of the design made the machine very easy to use.

words.definition: To sow means to plant seeds in the ground.
words.example: In the spring, the farmer sowed seeds in his fields.

words.definition: Soy is a kind of bean that is used to make food.
words.example: Many people use soy milk as a replacement for cow's milk.

words.definition: A spade is a tool used for digging.
words.example: The boy used his spade to build a sandcastle at the beach.

words.definition: When something is upcoming, it is happening soon.
words.example: She is very excited about her upcoming vacation.
